column4: hi everyone, I'm on 6.06 on amd64, how do I install firefox2?
you don't. Stick with 1.5, or upgrade to edgy
thanks. but it sounds too restrictive. pardon me, but in windows I can install both easily!
the advantages that ubuntu has over that proprietary OS you are mentioning are partly due to the fact that ubuntu keeps to a timetable
ff2 just doesn't fit in well with dapper. Yes, you can install it, but it will be a hack and will make it difficult to keep up with security fixes.

i see.. actualy I upgraded from 5.10 to 6.06, it was a lot of downloads (I received 5.10 CDs by post), and now I downloaded 6.10 and it's installer wont start X on my laptop! So, I decided to stay for a while on 6.06 (it's LTS, right?), but I'd like to have FF2, as it is really nicer than 1.5.
did you get the desktop or alternate of 6.10?
I downloaded CD ISO image, yes, correct, desktop
it did not detect my laptop monitor properly, I tried to edit xorg.conf, but without success
have you tried the 'vga=771' boot option?

yes, first time I was unable to switch to any text console (they were unreadable), then I specified correct VGA mode, and text consoles become accesible, and I tried to tweak xorg.conf, analyze X logfile, but then gave up.
sorry to hear that. What type of laptop is it?

MSI 635. And 5.10 installed our of the box! Moreover, I installed 5.10 64 bit, then upgraded to 6.06 64 bit, and no I decided to install fresh 6.10 32 bit, because I found that too many things are not available for 64 bit... E.g. some audio codecs, flash player, opera, etc...
s/no/now
it's probably worth searching on tuxmobil.de for reports on edgy installations on your particular model
for me, breezy, dapper and edgy worked on a Megabook 270
okay, I will, thanks. but anyway, somehow I can install FF2 in /usr/local and run it from there? :)
I unedrstood that FF2 will not be included in 6.06 repos...
yes, you can use the installer from mozilla.org -- it'll put it in /opt I think
thanks again for your help!
yw

btw, http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/all.html says: "Firefox 1.5: This version of Firefox will be supported until April 24, 2007 with security and stability updates. We strongly encourage all users to upgrade to Firefox 2." So, should FF2 be added to 6.06 repositories (theoretically)?
that's a developer decision
